Manchester City striker Sergio Aguero has vehemently denied reports that a member of his family was arrested in connection with a drugs raid back in his native Argentina. 
The home of his paternal grandmother was the alleged focus of the Buenos Aires police in a raid that took place in the Eucaliptos neighbourhood of Quilmes in relation to the sale of drugs and stolen goods. 
A woman allegedly related to the City forward was also arrested. 
The report detailed that police seized 200 grams of marijuana and firearms, but the 28-year-old has strongly refuted reports that his family was connected in any way. 
"I do not usually respond to rumours but in this case my family are involved and I cannot and do not wish to let it go," Aguero tweeted in Spanish. 
"The media reports that are circulating are false. My paternal grandparents have sadly passed away and my maternal grandparents live in Tucuman." Like us on Facebook
